radiographic_examinations.findings: Presence of megacystis and bilateral hydronephrosis.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Normal findings at previous ultrasound examinations at 20 and 24 weeks' gestational age.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Decreased venous return with presence of pulsative flow in the inferior vena cava and continuous elevated fetal heart rate.
Relapse of the megacystis with bilateral pyelectasis and oligohydramnios (AFI 2.4 cm).
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Possible due to healing of the bladder rupture.

radiographic_examinations.findings: No residual ascites, correct stent position, absence of hydronephrosis, normalization of AFI to 10.8 cm.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Resolution of ascites and hydronephrosis post-surgery.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Confirmed a right-sided grade I vesico-ureteral reflux (VUR).
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Minimal residual grade I VUR on repeat cystography at 12 months.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal kidneys with symmetrical function and good absolute renal clearance.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Normal renal clearance of 151 ml/minute/1.73 m2 at three years.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Confirmed spontaneous bladder rupture with fetal urinary ascites compressing the thoracic cavity, no signs of pulmonary hypoplasia, kidneys appeared normal.
